title: Group Anagrams
description:
Given a list of strings `strs`, group the anagrams together. You can return the answer in any order.

An anagram is a word formed by rearranging the letters of another word, using all the original letters exactly once.

Return a list of groups, where each group is a sorted list of anagrams. The groups themselves should be sorted by their first element.

examples.explanation: "eat", "tea", "ate" are anagrams; "tan", "nat" are anagrams; "bat" has no anagram partner.
A single empty string forms its own group.

constraints: strs[i] consists of lowercase English letters.
Each group must be sorted alphabetically.
Groups must be sorted by their first element.
